alert.note: Alert for Hanover; Louisa (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 9:25AM EDT until July 16 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Hanover County in central Virginia... Eastern Louisa County in central Virginia... * Until noon EDT. * At 925 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen during the past hour. An additional 1 to 2 inches of rain could fall in the next 45 minutes. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mineral, Bumpass, Fredericks Hall, Locust Creek, Beaverdam, Cuckoo, Apple Grove, Pendleton, Orchid, Coatesville, Hewlett and Noel. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 45 MINUTES
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
